intro: Cyphostemma pobeguinianum, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by fleshy, red berries. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found in woodlands and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
